thread.title: Twitter roasts AKA over 'Mitchells Plain' comments
thread.title_full: Twitter roasts AKA over 'Mitchells Plain' comments - Times LIVE

author: TshisaLIVE
title: Twitter roasts AKA over 'Mitchells Plain' comments
text:
Twitter roasts AKA over 'Mitchells Plain' comments TshisaLIVE | 10 February, 2017 12:00 Twitter goes after AKA for defending President Zuma. Twitter users hauled AKA over the coals after he defended President Zuma in a series of tweets during the chaotic #SONA2017. Tsotsi and Salt Bae: 10 hilarious #SONA2017 memes Twitter remembers Fana Mokoena's acting roles after #SONA2017 'beating' Move over Ndlozi: New people's bae spotted at #SONA2017 The president's address was filled with drama as EFF members were dragged out by Parliament security and pepper spray was released in the public gallery.
Move over Ndlozi: New people's bae spotted at #SONA2017 In the middle of it all, AKA sang the president's praises and seemed unfazed by corruption.
Corruption & politics go hand in hand pah ... just is what it is. GO GET YOURS!!!! Work hard, mind your business & MAKE YOUR MONEY.
— AKA (@akaworldwide) February 9, 2017 The outspoken rapper also told fans that it was up to them to make a life, just like his father who grew up poor in Mitchells Plain.
My father built a business, sent me and my bro to private schools he grew up in fuckin' Mitchell's Plein bro .... is that luck? Privledge?
— AKA (@akaworldwide) February 9, 2017 I carried on my fathers hard work by turning my dream into a reality by using my talent, now I have my own business. Is that luck?
— AKA (@akaworldwide) February 9, 2017 The comments saw AKA being dragged by followers who labelled him "arrogant" and "privileged".
@akaworldwide in mitchells plain they say yu are dead to them bcoz of your ignorence to own people suppoting criminals who steal money
— Vuyo jini (@vuyolweto) February 9, 2017 @akaworldwide say the opportunities are endless to the guy who can't afford fees and lives in shack and doesn't know where his next meal is!
— LT (@Lo_Ndoda) February 9, 2017 @akaworldwide what about the majority of South Africans? Please go sleep. I like you way too much to accept this ignorance please.
— sfisomankune (@SfisoMankune) February 9, 2017 @akaworldwide Yanya wena lost all respect I had for you after this rubbish you just said.
— dominic ngeleka (@DominicNgeleka) February 9, 2017 @akaworldwide Yoh 1st Class Ignorance At Its Best, Im So Appalled Ds is disappointing,Things ppl say wen dey are in a position of privileged
— NEGUS NEGAST (@NubianLastKing) February 10, 2017 @akaworldwide Its not about you but the millions who live in shacks and go hungry.Its about the unemployed and their plight.
— Ricky Singh (@Rikkising) February 10, 2017
